body_html:
@ezyang Indeed, due to ABI incompatibility between different compilers, and even different compiler versions (e.g. GCC 4.7 vs. 4.8), we will have to deal with the fact that people have to compile extensions with the same compiler as PyTorch itself. @zdevito suggested we ship PyTorch with information about what compiler it was compiled with (e.g. a file containing one line with that information), and then make it possible to check incompatibility with the system compiler in a way that at least emits a decent Python exception instead of just segfaulting.

@soumith Zach says ATen shouldn't require CUDA in its headers and that something is wrong about this
